origin.origPlace: Junnar, in an unfinished Chaitya in the series of caves in the southern spur of the Mānmoḍi hill about a mile east from the Chaitya, on the back of the recess over the door and alongside the window on its left, continguous to No. 13.

div.p: This edition is based on Burgess and Indraji 1881. Note (AO): jāvabhati perhaps refers to barley cultivation (see inscription number 15).

mahāveje gāme jāvabhati
udeseṇa nivataṇāni ṣaṇuvisa
sidhagaṇe aparājite
niasatāni selasa
mānamukaḍasa purato
talakavāḍake nivata
ṇāni tini || nagarasa
kaselaüde
seṇa nivataṇāni be

In the village of Mahāveja, twenty-six nivatanas for Jābabhati. To the Sidhagaṇa of the Aparājitas, three nivatanas given at the hill-foot near Mānamukaḍa hill; of the town... for... hill, tow nivatanas...
